description: Borrowed from Japanese カラオケ (karaoke), from 空(から) (kara, “empty”) + オケ (oke, “orchestra”), a clipping of オーケストラ (ōkesutora), from English orchestra.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) A form of entertainment popular in clubs, at parties, etc, in which individual members of the public sing along to pre-recorded instrumental versions of popular songs, the lyrics of which are displayed for the singer on a screen in time with the music.

examples: Synonym: (especially in the Korean context) noraebang

verbs.description: karaoke (third-person singular simple present karaokes, present participle karaokeing, simple past and past participle karaoked)
